physical_appearance:The image shows a poster and it has a white background. A big treble clef musical symbol adorns the background of the poster as well. There are three Chinese characters in gold and the year 1990
 displayed at the left hand side of the poster and on the treble clef symbol respectively. At the lower right side of the poster
 there are several vertical columns of Chinese characters as well as several numbers denoting dates
 a telephone number
 and a postal code. At the top of the poster
 there is a gold-coloured band where the logo of the Young Songwriters\u0027 Society is displayed.

sgcool_label_text:Xinyao is an abbreviated form of ????? (“Singapore songs” in Mandarin)
 a genre that emerged in the early 1980s in local schools and college campuses.\r\nThe first xinyao album
 (Tomorrow 21)
 was released in 1984 to overwhelming success. This was followed by the first xinyao festival in 1985. Among the well-known personalities of Xinyao are Eric Moo Billy Koh Liang Wern Fook Roy Loi Thomas Teo Dawn Gan and Pan Ying.\r\nThe Young Songwriters Society was formed in May 1986. Comprising of members from several xinyao groups
 the society aimed to promote their music. They also began to run the annual Xinyao festival that was organized by community centres.

metadata.title_text: Young Songwriters Society poster Young Songwriters Society poster 1990
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a poster and it has a white background. A big treble clef musical symbol adorns the background of the poster as well. There are three Chinese characters in gold and the year 1990, displayed at the left hand side of the poster and on the treble clef symbol respectively. At the lower right side of the poster, there are several vertical columns of Chinese characters as well as several numbers denoting dates, a telephone number, and a postal code. At the top of the poster, there is a gold-coloured band where the logo of the Young Songwriters' Society is displayed.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Posters Societies Music festivals Folk music Concerts
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
Xinyao is an abbreviated form of ????? (“Singapore songs” in Mandarin), a genre that emerged in the early 1980s in local schools and college campuses.
The first xinyao album, (Tomorrow 21), was released in 1984 to overwhelming success. This was followed by the first xinyao festival in 1985. Among the well-known personalities of Xinyao are Eric Moo Billy Koh Liang Wern Fook Roy Loi Thomas Teo Dawn Gan and Pan Ying.
The Young Songwriters Society was formed in May 1986. Comprising of members from several xinyao groups, the society aimed to promote their music. They also began to run the annual Xinyao festival that was organized by community centres.
